&#3942;&#3964;&#3851;&#3923;&#3928;: [2954] zhing las/ ... so nam byed pa/ ... so nam mkhan po/ ... so nam grong tsho/ ... so nam thon zog  ... so nam pa/ ... so nam yo byad/ ... zhing la so nam byas nas rtsam pa nyo dgos byung na/ nas dang sran ma'i sa bon btab dang ma btab mi 'dug  ... ming gi rnam grangs la 'jug byed dang/ 'tsho chas/ zhing las bcas so/

In Pha-dam-pa's way of speaking, gtan gyi so nam seems to mean 'permanent chores' (in this sense, including housework).  Zhi-byed Coll. II 187.6, 446.1; III 66.7.  The phrase nam zhag gtan gyi so nam, 'doing regular chores day and night' may be negative, if the chores are worldly, or positive if applied to spiritual practice.  nam zhag stan gya so nam dus da res la byed dgos sam mi dgos sems la lta rtog thong.  Zhi-byed Coll. V 122.1.
business, farming; agricultural work, farming/ commerce. harvest
